correction_response:
This tweet is somewhat misleading. While it's true that intent can be inferred from actions, the law also considers the context and circumstances surrounding the incident. In the case of Kyle Rittenhouse, he was charged with first-degree intentional homicide, but he claims he acted in self-defense. The determination of intent is not as clear-cut as the tweet suggests and is subject to interpretation and evidence presented in court. 
https://www.insideedition.com/christian-crowdfunding-site-raises-over-half-a-million-dollars-for-alleged-kenosha-shooter-kyle

- Rittenhouse is being held on homicide charges and is fighting extradition to Wisconsin where he would stand trial, the Chicago Tribune reported . He is being held without bail in Lake County's juvenile detention facility. If convicted as an adult, Rittenhouse could face a life sentence in jail, according to the Tribune.
